solution.text:
Volume of original tube = \((\pi{r_ o}^2 \times h) - (\pi{r_ i}^2 \times h)\)
\(= 10057.14 cm^3\)
Now, Volume of new tube = Volume of original tube
Let the length of the new tube be x
Therefore,\(V_ {new} = (\pi{r_ o}^2 \times h) - (\pi{r_ i}^2 \times h) = (\pi (\frac {18}{2})^2 \times x) - (\pi (\frac {18}{2} - 5)^2 \times x)\)
\(\Rightarrow x = \frac {V_ {original}}{\pi (\frac {18}2)^2-\pi (\frac {18}2 - m)^2}\)
= 49.23 cm

\(= 2\pi \times \frac{30}2 \times 2 + 2 \pi \times \frac{7}2 \times 2 + 2\pi({\frac{30}2}^2 - {\frac{7}2}^2)\)
= 1569.86\(cm^2\)
Therefore, cost of painting the pipe \(= 1569.86 \times 0.2\)
= Rs. 313.97

solution.text:
Given the volume of the pipe = V = 9136.29 \(cm^3\)
The volume of a cylindrical pipe = \(\pi{r_ o}^2h - \pi{r_ i}^2h\)
Let the thickness of the pipe be \(x\)
\(\Rightarrow V = \pi (11)^2 \times 51 - \pi (11-x)^2 \times 51\)
\(\Rightarrow \frac {V}{51\pi}=11^2 - (11-x)^2\)
\(\Rightarrow (11-x)^2 = 121 - \frac{V}{51\pi}\)
\(\Rightarrow x = 11 - 8\)
\(\Rightarrow x = 3\)
Therefore, the thickness of the pipe is 3 cm

content.text: The volume of a metallic cylinder pipe is 9136.29 cubic centimetres. Its length is 51 cm and its external radius is 11 cm. Find its thickness

solution.text:
Volume of pipe=Difference in volumes between outer and inner cylinder
\(= \pi{r_ o}^2 \times h - \pi{r_ i}^2 \times h\)
\(= \pi (12)^2 \times 37 - \pi(10)^2 \times 37\)
= 5116.57\( cm^3\)
\(Mass = Volume \times Density\)
\(\Rightarrow Mass = 5116.57 cm^3 \times \frac{8.6 g}{cm^3}\)
= 44002.51 g

Volume of new cuboid = \(lbh\) = Volume of cylinder
Therefore, \(lbh = 17864 cm^3\)
\(\Rightarrow 34 \times 16 \times h = 17864 cm^3\)
\(\Rightarrow h = \frac {17864}{34 \times 16} = 32.84\)
The new cuboid is 32.84 cm tall

Rise of water level = h = 14 cm
Therefore, volume of rain water harvested \(= 31428.57 \times 14 = 440000 cm^3\)

content.text: You have set up a rain-water harvesting system at your home. A cylindrical container with a radius of 10 dm collects rain-water from your roof. It rained last Monday and some water was collected, raising the height of water in the container by 14 cm. What volume of rain water was collected?

hint.text: Volume of a cylinder = \(πr^2h\). Also note that 1dm = 10cm

solution.text:
Total Curved Surface Area = \(2\pi rh = 132 cm^2\)
\(\Rightarrow 2rh = \frac{132}{\pi} = 42 cm^2\)
Once you cut the slice, there are three faces without icing: The curved outer surface and the two rectangular inner surfaces. (Remember that the top and bottom surfaces have icing)
Also, length of Base of Slice = Radius of Cylinder and Height of Slice = Height of Cylinder
Therefore, area of the slice that has no icing
= Curved area of slice + 2 \(\times\) Rectangular surface area of slice
\(= \frac{1}{10}\)(Total Curved Surface Area) + 2 \(\times\) (Base \(\times\) Height of slice)
\(= \frac {1}{10}\times 132 + 2rh\)
\(= \frac {1}{10}\times 132 + 42\)
= 55.2 \(cm^2\)

content.text: You are given a cylindrical cake with icing on the top and bottom. There is no icing on the curved surface and the curved surface area is \(132 cm^2\). hint.text: Think about your slice as a separate object. What faces do not have icing?

solution.text:
Volume of the brick wall \(= 13 m \times 3 m \times 0.5 m = 19.5 m^3\)
Volume of one brick \(= 20 cm \times 10 cm \times 5 cm = 1000 cm^3\)
\(1 m^3 = 1000000 cm^3\)
Therefore, number of bricks required \(= 19.5 \times \frac{1000000}{1000}\)
\(= 19500\)

solution.text:
If the height is doubled :
V \(= \pi r^2\times h\)
\({V_ {new}} = \pi r^2 \times(2h) = 2\pi r^2 \times h = 2V\)
Therefore, the volume will double

content.text: If the height is doubled:

solution.text:
If the radius is doubled :
V \(= \pi r^2h\)
\({V_ {new}} = \pi (2r)^2h = 4\pi r^2h = 4V\)
Therefore, the volume will quadruple

content.text: If the radius is doubled:

solution.text:
If the radius is halved :
V \(= \pi r^2h\)
\(V_ {new} = \pi (\frac r2)^2h = \frac V4\)
Therefore, the volume will quarter

content.text: If the radius is halved:
A cylinder has a radius r, a height h and a volume V

solution.text:
Curved surface area (CSA) = \(2\pi rh\)
Total surface area = \(2\pi r (r+h) = 2\pi r^2 + 2\pi rh = 3 \times CSA = 1848\)
Therefore, \(2\pi r^2 + 2\pi rh = 6\pi rh\)
\(\Rightarrow 2\pi r^2 = 4\pi rh\)
\(\Rightarrow r = 2h\)
\(\Rightarrow h = \frac {r}{2}\)
\(CSA = \frac{1848}3 = 2\pi rh = 2\pi r(\frac {r}{2}) = \pi r^2\)
\(\Rightarrow\) Area of Base = \(\pi r^2 = \frac{1848}3\)
\(\Rightarrow r^2 = \frac {1848\times 7}{3\times 22}\)
\(\Rightarrow r = 14 cm\)
\(\Rightarrow h = \frac {r}{2} = 7 cm\)
Therefore, volume \(= \pi r^2h = 4312 cm^3\)

\(= (4429 - 53(10)) m^2\)
\(=3899 m^2\)

content.text: Kshitij is looking to landscape his garden. He made a diagram of his house (grey colour) but forgot to mention the exact dimensions of the garden area. solution.text:
Cross section of river area = Area of 1 + Area of 2 \(= ac \times \frac 12 (d-c) (a+b) = 121 \times 33 + \frac 12 \times 48\times(121 + 91)\)
\(= 9081 m^2\)
Rate of flow = 7 km/hr = 7000 m/hr
Volume of water flow = Area of cross section \(\times\) Rate of flow
\(= 9081 \times 7000 = 63567000 m^3/hr\)
= 63567 megalitre/hr
One week = 7 days =\( 24 \times 7\) hours = 168 hours
Therefore, volume of water flowing into the sea in one week \(= 168 \times 63567\)
= 10679256 megalitres

content.text: The dimensions of a cuboid are in the ratio of 6:5:2 (l:b:h). If the total surface area is 104 \(m^2\). What is the length of the cuboid?
What is the Breadth of the cuboid?

solution.text:
Let length:breadth:height = 6x:5x:2x
Therefore, Surface Area of the cuboid = \(2(6 \times 5x^2 + 5 \times 2x^2 + 2 \times 6x^2)\)
= \(2(52)x^2\)
= \(104x^2\)
Given that surface area is \(104 m^2\)
Therefore, \(104 m^2 = 104 x^2\)
\(\Rightarrow x^2 = \frac{104}{104}\)
\(\Rightarrow x = \sqrt{1}\)
\(\Rightarrow\) x = 1 metres

Therefore River Side Length = \(\frac{869}{11} - 19\)
\(= 60 m\)

=\(\frac{\sqrt{3}}{4}\times 1764 cm^2\)

content.text: A cube has an edge measuring 4 cm. Find the number of cubes of edge 2 cm that can be cut off from it.

hint.text: Find the volume of the large cube and compare it to the volume of the smaller cube

solution.text:
Total surface area of all the cubes \(= 5 \times 6 \times 1.4^2 = 58.8 cm^2\)
Area of each face =\(1.4^2 cm^2\)
Number of faces that face inward = 10 faces
Therefore, outer surface area = 58.8 - 19.6 = 39.2 \(cm^2\)
Cost of paint = Rs 8 per \(cm^2\)
Therefore, total cost of painting the object = \(39.2 \times 8\)
= Rs. 313.6

content.text: Five cubes of edge 1.4 cm each are placed side by side and stuck together as shown. The cost of painting is Rs 8 per \(cm^2\). What is the cost of painting the outer surface of the entire object?
